Title: Skin care products you donâ€™t need | save your money
Description:
With a new product being launched everyday, the skin are space is crowded with products you donâ€™t need
Here are a few 

âŒVitamin c powders
These are a no no. It can cause irritation if not miceâ€™s properly and they do clump up. You donâ€™t need such a concentrated form  of  vitamin c as it can cause irritation which may heal with darkening. 
â–ªï¸Substitute: Use a regular 10 or 20% vitamin C serum 

âŒFeminine hygiene products
Mild watery vaginal discharge is normal. It is also normal for the discharge to have a slight smell it doesnâ€™t mean there is an infection and it absolutely doesnâ€™t mean you need special products to wash your vulva. Vaginal walls are made in a way that it is self cleaning. There is no need to clean the internal area. 
â–ªï¸Substitute: The vulva can be washed with gentle soap and water, the same products used for body. You do not need anything special or specific for it. 

âŒFacial oils 
Oils sit on the top of skin and donâ€™t to much to your skin. If you have dry skin, a thick moisturiser is a better option than an oil 
â–ªï¸Substitute: moisturiser with glycerine, Shea butter, cocoa butter, triglycerides, ceramides. 

âŒPhysical exfoliants 
No matter how fine the particles are, physical exfoliants can cause micro tears in the skin and irritate the skin. â–ªï¸Substitute : Use glycolic or lactic acid instead for a more predictable uniform exfoliation. 

âŒMassaging tools 
They are not harmful but a waste of money.  You will not get chiseled face, high cheekbones or a sharp jawlines with these. And as for better absorption of product, massaging with fingers do the job.
â–ªï¸Substitute: massage upwards and outwards with your hands.
